abstracts.cdata!:
The Sixth Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit (PRSC-6) Project is part of a series of operations
            supporting the implementation of the Poverty Reduction
            Strategy Paper (PRSP) for the period 2004-2006. The PRSP has
            four strategic pillars: 1) accelerating broad-based growth;
            2) promoting access to social services; 3) increasing
            employment and income-generating activities for the poor;
            and, 4) promoting good governance. The PRSC series supports
            the PRSP implementation under three components consistent
            with the four pillars of the PRSP: a) growth and employment
            creation; b) human resource development; and, c) good
            governance. Under the growth and employment creation
            component, the PRSC-6 supports institutional reforms that
            will increase private sector participation in the cotton,
            telecommunication, and energy sectors, accelerating growth
            through higher investment and improved productivity and
            competitiveness. The second component includes policies to
            lower the cost of services and improve access and quality in
            the education, health, social protection, and water sectors.
            The third component encompasses policy measures to
            strengthen budget formulation, execution, procurement, and
            control. This component also supports the strengthening of
            public sector performance, greater decentralization, and
            better environmental management. Project risks arise from
            the country's weak institutional capacity, adverse
            developments in commodity prices and exchange rates, and
            regional instability.
